page.title: 09Acocks Green Carnival
page.content: On the first Saturday in July each year a carnival is held in Acocks Green. The Carnival Committee's purpose is to provide entertainment and the opportunity for community and other voluntary groups to raise funds. Last year a record profit of seven hundred pounds was made by the carnival committee itself and all of the stallholders were pleased with their takings. I was the princess in the Carnival. I rode in a pony and trap with the carnival queen, Karen Humphries. The procession began at 1.15 p.m. and we arrived at the Carnival Ground just before 2.00 p.m. I helped the Carnival Queen to present the Fancy Dress prizes and then we watched the displays in the main arena. These included Majorettes, Keep Fit, Air Cadets and The Westerners who wore American Civil War costumes.
